description: Hungary announced a two week curfew starting on March 28 where citizens could not leave their house except to go to work or run essential errands. Those above 65 could only visit groceries stores, markets and pharmacies from 9-12 am, citizens below that age are only allowed in these establishments outside of these hours.

Hungary announced a two week curfew starting on March 28 where citizens could not leave their house except to go to work or run essential errands. On April 9 Hungary extended the curfew indefinitely. UPDATE: Hungary originally announced a two week curfew but has extended the curfew indefinitely

Hungary introduced a nightly curfew between 00:01 and 05:00 from 5 November where citizens could not leave their house except to go to work or run essential errands. This "special legal order" is set to remain in force for 90 days.

description: Laos: The Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism has issued a notice discouraging the organisation of large events including weddings, as the government intensifies efforts to minimise the risk of a Covid-19 outbreak. Head of Office of the ministry, Mr Vansy Kuamua, signed the notice on March 10, giving provincial culture and tourism departments and relevant bodies nationwide authority to request the postponement of festivals and events, such as weddings, which draw a large crowd.
